file_content.text: Remember me? Agent Soganti with the Republic Customs Office. I have some questions about Beryl Thorne.
What do you want to know, agent?
Ask away.
I'm busy right now.
This won't take long, and it's not a request.
Get lost, laser brains.
That's no way to speak to a man who can revoke your flight clearance. If I were you, I'd cooperate.
I suspect Thorne is smuggling relics, and I think I know how she's doing it. What I lack is proof.
I need someone to step forward and testify so I can arrest her. I'm looking for an honest citizen, Captain.
If I see one, I'll let you know.
Honest citizen, huh?
That's funny. Really.
Beryl's a good person. She's not doing anything wrong.
Leave her alone.
If I catch you covering for her... well, let's not consider the ugly implications.
I'm authorized to pay a generous sum for any lead resulting in an arrest. Think about what's best for you.
Are you absolutely sure you don't know anything about Beryl Thorne's criminal activities?
I'll say whatever you want, for the right price.
I'm looking for a reward.
I only pay for leads that result in an arrest--hard evidence.
If you know something about Beryl, I'd love to hear it.
Beryl just looks dishonest, that's all. I have the same problem.
You've got her all wrong.
Go on, have a good laugh--while you still can.
Tyrodall is the real smuggler, Agent Soganti.
Her first mate is a criminal.
Thorne's partner? What do you have to back up that accusation?
The crazy Devaronian attacked me at the scavenger base. It was his last mistake.
I killed Tyrodall.
You admit to being with scavengers and killing a man--what makes you think I won't arrest you?
Tyrodall wasn't the only scavenger I killed. I did you all sorts of favors, agent.
Because I'm on your side.
If Tyrodall was smuggling relics with those scum... they deserve what they got.
No body, for starters. I can tell you where to find it, though.
Lack of evidence?
I think you'd say anything to protect Thorne. That's too bad.
You're welcome to try arresting me, lawman.
Give it your best shot.
You have a killer's attitude, I'll give you that much.
I saw Tyrodall running with a bunch of scavengers. They were stealing Republic supplies.
I'm an eyewitness.
I heard the scavengers were raiding our excavation. And that Devaronian's alleged "death" always seemed a little convenient....
Sounds like I might be wrong about Thorne.
Unfortunately, I may never be able to verify your story. I'm afraid that means no reward.
Just leave poor Beryl alone. She's innocent.
I didn't do it for the reward.
Nobody's innocent. If I've learned anything in this job, it's that.
But think of all the time and money you'll save by not chasing the wrong people.
Not even a little?
Fair point. I'll transfer some credits to you from my discretionary account.
Buy yourself a drink on me. Goodbye, Captain.
Quit annoying me and we'll call it even.
Silence is all I want.
You don't enjoy our little chats? I'm hurt.
You've been very helpful, Captain. Goodbye.
Can't you just trust me on it?
Not much.
Why would I? You're obviously wasting my time.
The Force told me Tyrodall is evil. Seriously.
[Lie] Just my Jedi powers....
Laugh it up, all the way to a prison cell--because that's where you're headed.
Nobody escapes justice forever, Captain. Nobody.
You've got nothing on me or Beryl. You're all smoke and no fire, agent.
I will.
This was fun.
Keep practicing that line, agent. Someday it might scare someone.
You don't intimidate me.
Let's go, men.
Beryl must leave. Warn her.
It's only a matter of time before someone gives her up to Soganti.
I will.
Yes. It's not safe here.
A timely warning is worth a lot, don't you think?
There may even be a reward.
It will bring good luck. That's enough.
We've got our own problems.
She can handle herself.
She has honor. She deserves help.
Let's go to her now.
Beryl needs to clear out of here. That agent won't give up.
I don't want Beryl getting caught.
Agreed.
Me neither. She's one of the good guys.
Maybe she'll pay me for the tip?
There may even be a reward.
Is everything about credits with you?
That's her problem, not mine.
She can handle herself.
If the situation was reversed, I'm betting she'd help us out.
We should drop by her place on our way to Zone Zero. It's the least we can do.
What were you thinking, protecting Beryl? Are you trying to complicate our lives?
Why aren't you on the ship?
What are you doing here?
Because a visit from Republic Customs is never a good thing--and he's been here twice.
I think I handled him pretty well.
I don't understand.
Of course you do. He wants you overconfident so you'll slip up.
I like seeing you upset. It's kind of a hobby.
No, just yours.
When Republic Customs agents take a personal interest in spacers, it always ends badly.
We don't want that agent snooping around here again. Beryl needs to draw the heat away from us.
Tell her to get off Taris right away. It's the best thing for everyone.
I caught Beryl hiding relics inside those core sample containers.
I'll tell you everything.
I knew it. Regulations keep me from opening those containers, but now I have an eyewitness.
My men will arrest Thorne immediately. Her smuggling operation is finished.
Take your reward. With my compliments.
That's mighty generous of you, Agent Soganti.
Thanks.
I should go.
Keep your compliments. All I want are the credits.
This doesn't make us friends.
The Republic appreciates your assistance.
Beryl helped us. This was wrong.
I can't believe you rolled over on Beryl.
We need to keep the heat off us.
It had to be done.
Sacrificing friends brings bad luck.
There had to have been a better way.
I wish I could take it back.
I regret it already.
It's too late. Now we live with it.
That makes two of us.
When I want your opinion I'll give it to you.
Shut your mouth.
Just try!
Doesn't mean I'll accept it.
Enjoy the rest of your time on my planet, Captain.
I'm Agent Soganti with the Republic Customs Office. What brings you to my planet, Captain?
Last time I checked, Taris was Republic territory.
Your planet?
When you have as many responsibilities as I do, you develop a sense of ownership about a planet.
What's your job? Showing me how to shake hands with the natives?
Republic Customs Office?
Hard to believe a spacer like you never encountered Republic Customs before.
I don't have to answer that.
Stow the attitude unless you want me to impound that ship of yours.
The Republic Customs Office monitors all starship traffic and ensures no illegal goods are transported on or off this planet.
There's a lot of contraband making its way around Taris. If you see anything suspicious, I suggest you report it immediately.
Why so much illegal activity around here?
Contraband?
Lots of nice things are still buried in the ruins of old Taris. This planet is one big party for grave robbers and scavengers.
Is there a reward for information?
Does it pay?
I pay for any lead that results in an arrest. An honest person could make a lot of money.
How will I know "suspicious"?
That's right, you have "solid citizen" written all over you.
I take a special interest in every new arrival to my planet, Captain. Keep your nose clean, and we won't have any trouble. Clear?
I'll stay as clean as Alderaan snow.
Positively.
We'll see about that.
Do you give this speech to everyone?
This feels personal.
Just the ones I think need to hear it.
Are we done here?
Can I go?
For now.
Enjoy your visit to Taris.
I'm not here for you. Move along.
